p:
Climate change represents a threat to food security, particularly resulting from ongoing and anticipated negative impacts on agricultural productivity (yields/hectare)
28– 32 . While there have been a range of studies which indicate negative impacts on yields of major staple crops
33– 35 , there have been fewer studies that have investigated the impact of climate change stresses (e.g. rising CO 2, heat, drought) on staple crop grain quality parameters
17, 36– 40 .
